question: The Central Adoption Resource Authority (CARA) recently celebrated its 5th annual day. CARA is a statutory body of which ministry?
option2: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
option3: Ministry of Women and Child Development
option4: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
answer: Ministry of Women and Child Development
explanation:
Central Adoption Resource Authority (CARA) is a statutory body of Union Ministry of Women & Child Development. It is the nodal body for adoption of Indian children and regulation of adoption processes inside the country and within countries. In 2003, the Government of India ratified the Hague Convention on Inter-country Adoption of 1993.
Recently, CARA celebrated its 5th Annual Day in New Delhi and the event was attended by the officials of the Union Ministry of Women & Child Development.
